definition: small sum of money/loose change/Cantonese equivalent of 零錢|零钱[ling2 qian2]
to scatter money/to give to charity
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: First he brought the bills and then the loose receipts of the day.
sentences.chinese: 他先拿了那些鈔票，然後又拿了當天進的散錢。

sentences.english: In addition to its lending, the government is showering money on the private sector through direct spending.
sentences.chinese: 除放貸外，政府還通過直接支出向私營經濟大筆散錢。

sentences.english: Can I just pretend I already tossed some change in the tip jar?
sentences.chinese: 我可否裝着已經擲了一些散錢在小費罐裏？
